alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Bennington and southwestern Windham Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wilmington, or 11 miles east of Bennington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Readsboro, Whitingham, Dover, Marlboro, Halifax, Jacksonville, Searsburg, South Newfane, Readsboro Falls, Williamsville, Four Corners, Woodford State Park, Williamsville Station, Heartwellville, West Halifax, Whitneyville, Medburyville, Harrisville and Brookside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
